idea-plugin.name: Android WiFiADB
idea-plugin.description:
Android Studio plugin that allows you to connect Android devices over Wi-Fi.

FREE VERSION

Usage:

- Please ensure your computer was configured adb in PATH. Then verify it by typing command 'adb' in the terminal or cmd. more about adb -> Android Debug Bridge

- Open WiFiADB tools from NavBar > Tools > WiFiADB, or use keyboard-shortcut Ctrl+Alt+2.

- Connecting your Android device to compute by USB > click "Refresh" button > select "Connect". Keep in mind that it will remember your device next time.

- If it does not find your device, you can check the logs by going to MenuBar Tools > Log.

Contribute

Using Wi-Fi connect android device help us get rid of the usb cable. I had tried other similar tool, but they are not faultless, hope this tool will bring convenience to your work.

GitHub : WiFiADB

If you have any questions, please create issue.
